content.description: Smooth Ride starts when you kick it like a ninja and stem some enjoyable moves at the first bolt.  Swing left onto slopers and keep that core tight for the crux bulge.  Catch your breath and enjoy a fun little dihedral and nice slab climbing to the chains.
content.location: Smooth Ride is located in the middle of the crag.

content.description: Silk starts on an arete with a solid boulder sequence that is well protected. A moderate section will bring you to a second crux above the ledge.  Finish on fun slab and slopers.
content.location: Silk is located on an arete next to the stream near the upper section of the crag.

content.description: On The Rocks starts by traversing left under a 45 degree roof on two bolts. A nice sequence of slopers and hidden feet will put you on the arete with one more crux to go.  The upper portion of the route is on fun dihedrals and sloping ramps.
content.location: On The Rocks can easily be located by looking for two bolts underneath a left traversing overhang.

content.description: Meowtain Breeze climbs up a broken ramp to access a nice dihedral. Some steming moves through the middle will bring you to the upper section where you will find an anchor at the top of the face. There is a double bolt chain at the top of this route. (due to Covid 19, Lead bolts are planned for summer of 2021)
content.location: Meowtain Breeze  start a 15 ft right of a large boulder located next to the stream. It climbs the first inside corner on the wall.

content.description: Lost & Found follows a narrow staircase of sloping holds to reach a smoth dihedral. What looks like a walk in the park will throw a curve ball halfway up the route.  Cross broken rock and finish on a steep section below the chains.
content.location: Lost & Found is located in the middle of the Crag and is characterized by a easy start followed by a large dihedral.

content.description: Grounded start in an inside corner and climb moderate moves for 25 feet. A thin crack to your left and off-width inside corner to your right will lead you up steep, quality rock for a short a sequence and put you on the upper ramp. Scramble left to the anchor. There is a double bolt chain at the top of this route. (due to Covid 19, Lead bolts are planned for summer of 2021)
content.location: Grounded is located 30 feet uphill from a large Boulder next to the stream. Follow a prominent dihedral.

content.description: Glacial Gifts start with some great steaming to reach a wild sloping boulder move. Cross the ramp and get back on to technical tension climbing on the second half of the route.
content.location: Glacial Gifts is located next to the stream in the middle of the cliff and is characterized by a short, smooth dihedral that starts off the route.

content.description: Cracked Nice in the upper most inside corner and climb a nice crack for 20 feet on good gear. Place a high cam and change up styles for a cruxs sequence to reach the ramp.  Climb a fun slab on the upper half of the route and clip the chains. trad 2"
content.location: This route is located in the uppermost dihedral at the crag.

content.description: Chill-out begins on a half buried boulder and requires an interesting first move to get on the wall.  Continue up nice slab and slopers to a ledge half way up the route.  Pull another boulder move and enjoy cruiser moves to the finish line.  6 bolts.
content.location: Chillout is located on the slab face just left of the uppermost dihedral at the crag.

content.description: Brainfreeze starts right of a large boulder at the base of the cliff and follow a right trending arete on moderate terain. This route enjoys the line of least resistance at the left left edge of the crag. There is a double bolt chain at the top of this route. (due to Covid 19, Lead bolts are planned for summer of 2021)
content.location: This route is located at the left edge of the crag. Start climbing just right of a large boulder next to the stream.

content.description: All Mixed Up starts up moderate terrain before entering a crux sectipn of polished rock and a thin crack.  Pull a couple bulges to reach the chains at the top of this feature. There is a double bolt chain at the top of this route. (due to Covid 19, Lead bolts are planned for summer of 2021)
content.location: All Mixed Up follows the left most prominent Arete at the Crag.

content.description: This north facing cliff consist of high-quality rock that has been polished from the recent glacial retreat. The routes are all about 60 feet long and most are fully bolted. If you are climbing at the grade then this is definitely worth the approach. Be sure to bring a jacket because the breeze coming off of the glacier can be a bit nippy. An added bonus of this wall is that the ice for your Margaritas are never far away :-)
